column5: Just a reminder to everyone that with the temps quickly dropping its about that time to shut off your outside hosebibs for the winter. Or, you can wait and go from     to    in a hurry.Thats all, HOHOHO.
Geez, thanks for the reminder. I remembered to do it the other day, but I never got around to it. I just ran to my basement and turned off the outside taps!

Well about 7 yrs ago i got a reminder of why we should shut of our outside hoses,as it broke,right at the wall about 2am !!!!.  ...the sound of running water in the basement woke me up !!!!   a very big mess,and a bigger lesson learned !!!    we did ours about 3 weeks ago,thanks fore the heads up !!!  cheers
Hosebibs!... I like that!  ... proper terminology!
Thanks for the reminder Jigger Got that done in late October, just before deer hunting Tight lines Leechman
Its a myth,dont bother yerself with that shutting off and draining thing.Leave the hose hooked up also.Makes it easier to wash the old salt off of the truck in the winter. Joe
Mine is still hooked up,, Might have to rinse off the boat from a late season Muskie report
What's your plan my good old friend??
The plan is to sleep in tomorrow and Sunday ,, then sneak out to McBay for and ice Inspection   Ice Ice Baby
Query for Glen and the Plummas:  How do I tell the difference between a hosebib and a sillcock?  Thanks in advance.    Hope this hleps.
